hypothesis_content.title: BTC Implied Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC's 7-day realized volatility falls below its 30-day realized volatility by more than 15 percentage points (indicating compression), and BTC price is trading within +/-3% of its 20-day moving average in a NEUTRAL regime, a volatility expansion will occur within 3 trading days, with the direction of the breakout aligning with the initial 2-hour move post-trigger.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility compression in neutral regimes is a classic precursor to expansion. The market is currently in a neutral state with news highlighting 'volatility returns'. This setup isolates periods of abnormally low short-term volatility compared to medium-term, creating a statistical 'spring'.
entry_conditions: BTC price between 97% and 103% of its 20-day SMA
Monitor for a 2-hour closing price move > 1.5% away from the trigger-time price

exit_conditions.take_profit: 7D Realized Volatility rises to meet or exceed the 30D Realized Volatility level
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price moves >5% in the opposite direction of the initial 2-hour breakout
exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 trading days after entry if neither TP nor SL is hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 50% of qualified signals result in continued compression (7D RV remains >15% below 30D RV) or a false breakout (reversal beyond the 5% stop-loss) over a 100-signal backtest.
